benchmark_details.name: Linguistic Benchmark
benchmark_details.overview: We introduce a comprehensive Linguistic Benchmark designed to evaluate the limitations of Large Language Models (LLMs) in domains such as logical reasoning, spatial intelligence, and linguistic understanding, among others. Through a series of straightforward questions, it uncovers the significant limitations of well-regarded models to perform tasks that humans manage with ease.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark that evaluates LLMs on their reasoning capabilities and identify their limitations.

data.source: 30 crafted questions focusing on various reasoning tasks, developed by the authors.
data.annotation: Judged by authors based on model responses.

methodology.calculation: Scores are calculated based on the precision of answers and adherence to logical principles.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores denote better performance in logical reasoning and task understanding.
methodology.validation: Evaluated against popular LLMs and human responses.
